member.name: M:Thorlabs.PM100D.PM100D.#ctor(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: This function creates an IVI instrument driver session, typically using the C session instrument handle.
member.param: The instrument handle that is used to create an IVI instrument driver session.

member.name: M:Thorlabs.PM100D.PM100D.#ctor(System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary:
This function initializes the instrument driver session and performs the following initialization actions:
(1) Opens a session to the Default Resource Manager resource and a session to the specified device using the Resource Name specified. (2) Performs an identification query on the instrument. (3) Resets the instrument to a known state. (4) Sends initialization commands to the instrument. (5) Returns an instrument handle which is used to distinguish between different sessions of this instrument driver.
Notes: (1) Each time this function is invoked a unique session is opened.
member.param:
This parameter specifies the device (resource) with which to establish a communication session. The syntax for the Instrument Descriptor is shown below. Optional segments are shown in square brackets ([]). Required segments that must be filled in are denoted by angle brackets (<>).
USB[board]::0x1313::product id ::serial number[::interface number][::INSTR]
Remote Access visa://hostname[:port]/resource
The default values for optional parameters are shown below.
Optional Segment Default Value --------------------------------------- board 0 USB interface number 0
The product id codes for supported instruments are shown below.
Product ID Instrument Type ------------------------------------------------- 0x8070 PM100D with DFU interface enabled 0x8071 PM100A with DFU interface enabled 0x8072 PM100USB with DFU interface enabled 0x8078 PM100D with DFU interface disabled 0x8079 PM100A with DFU interface disabled 0x80B0 PM200
Example Resource Strings: -------------------------------------------------------------- USB::0x1313::0x8070::M12345678::INSTR PM100D with a serial number of M12345678.
USB::0x1313::0x80B0::M12345678::INSTR PM200 with a serial number of M12345678.
visa://1.2.3.4/USB::0x1313::0x8071::M23456789::INSTR Remote access to the PM100A with a serial number of M23456789 at the specified IP address.
visa://hostname/USB::0x1313::0x8072::M34567890::INSTR Remote access to the PM100USB with a serial number of M23456789 on the specified host.
Note: You may use VISA <Find Resources> with an appropriate seach pattern to get the Resource Name for your device. For PM100x devices use: "USB?*::0x1313::0x807?::?*::INSTR" For PM200 devices use: "USB?*::0x1313::0x80B?::?*::INSTR"

This parameter specifies whether an identification query is performed during the initialization process.
VI_OFF (0): Skip query. VI_ON (1): Do query (default).

This parameter specifies whether the instrument is reset during the initialization process.
VI_OFF (0) - no reset VI_ON (1) - instrument is reset (default)

member.name: M:Thorlabs.PM100D.PM100D.setTime(System.Int16,System.Int16,System.Int16,System.Int16,System.Int16,System.Int16)
member.summary:
This function sets the system date and time of the powermeter.
Notes: (1) Date and time are displayed on instruments screen and are used as timestamp for data saved to memory card. (2) The function is only available on PM100D and PM200.
member.param: This parameter specifies the actual year in the format yyyy e.g. 2009.
This parameter specifies the actual month in the format mm e.g. 01.
This parameter specifies the actual day in the format dd e.g. 15.
This parameter specifies the actual hour in the format hh e.g. 14.
This parameter specifies the actual minute in the format mm e.g. 43.
This parameter specifies the actual second in the format ss e.g. 50.
member.returns: This is the error code returned by the function call. For error codes and descriptions see <Error Message>.

member.name: M:Thorlabs.PM100D.PM100D.getTime(System.Int16@,System.Int16@,System.Int16@,System.Int16@,System.Int16@,System.Int16@)
member.summary:
This function returns the system date and time of the powermeter.
Notes: (1) Date and time are displayed on instruments screen and are used as timestamp for data saved to memory card. (2) The function is only available on PM100D and PM200.
member.param: This parameter specifies the actual year in the format yyyy.
This parameter specifies the actual month in the format mm.
This parameter specifies the actual day in the format dd.
This parameter specifies the actual hour in the format hh.
This parameter specifies the actual minute in the format mm.
This parameter specifies the actual second in the format ss.
member.returns: This is the error code returned by the function call. For error codes and descriptions see <Error Message>.

member.name: M:Thorlabs.PM100D.PM100D.setLineFrequency(System.Double)
member.summary: This function selects the line frequency.
member.param:
This parameter specifies the line frequency.
Acceptable values: PM100D_LINE_FREQ_50 (0): 50Hz PM100D_LINE_FREQ_60 (1): 60Hz
member.returns:
This value shows the status code returned by the function call.
For Status Codes see function <Error Message>.

member.name: M:Thorlabs.PM100D.PM100D.getLineFrequency(System.Int16@)
member.summary: This function returns the selected line frequency.
member.param:
This parameter returns the selected temperature sensor.
Return values: PM100D_LINE_FREQ_50 (0): 50Hz PM100D_LINE_FREQ_60 (1): 60Hz
member.returns: This is the error code returned by the function call. For error codes and descriptions see <Error Message>.

member.name: M:Thorlabs.PM100D.PM100D.getBatteryVoltage(System.Double@)
member.summary:
This function is used to obtain the battery voltage readings from the instrument.
Remark: (1) This function is only supported with the PM160. (2) This function obtains the latest battery voltage measurement result. (3) With the USB cable connected this function will obtain the loading voltage. Only with USB cable disconnected (Bluetooth connection) the actual battery voltage can be read.
member.param: This parameter returns the battery voltage in volts [V].
member.returns: This is the error code returned by the function call. For error codes and descriptions see <Error Message>.

member.name: M:Thorlabs.PM100D.PM100D.writeRegister(System.Int16,System.Int16)
member.summary: This function writes the content of any writable instrument register. Refer to your instrument's user's manual for more details on status structure registers.
member.param:
Specifies the register to be used for operation. This parameter can be any of the following constants:
PM100D_REG_SRE (1): Service Request Enable PM100D_REG_ESE (3): Standard Event Enable PM100D_REG_OPER_ENAB (6): Operation Event Enable Register PM100D_REG_OPER_PTR (7): Operation Positive Transition PM100D_REG_OPER_NTR (8): Operation Negative Transition PM100D_REG_QUES_ENAB (11): Questionable Event Enable Reg. PM100D_REG_QUES_PTR (12): Questionable Positive Transition PM100D_REG_QUES_NTR (13): Questionable Negative Transition PM100D_REG_MEAS_ENAB (16): Measurement Event Enable Register PM100D_REG_MEAS_PTR (17): Measurement Positive Transition PM100D_REG_MEAS_NTR (18): Measurement Negative Transition PM100D_REG_AUX_ENAB (21): Auxiliary Event Enable Register PM100D_REG_AUX_PTR (22): Auxiliary Positive Transition PM100D_REG_AUX_NTR (23): Auxiliary Negative Transition
This parameter specifies the register value.
member.returns: This is the error code returned by the function call. For error codes and descriptions see <Error Message>.

member.name: M:Thorlabs.PM100D.PM100D.readRegister(System.Int16,System.Int16@)
member.summary: This function reads the content of any readable instrument register. Refer to your instrument's user's manual for more details on status structure registers.
member.param:
Specifies the register to be used for operation. This parameter can be any of the following constants:
PM100D_REG_STB (0): Status Byte Register PM100D_REG_SRE (1): Service Request Enable PM100D_REG_ESB (2): Standard Event Status Register PM100D_REG_ESE (3): Standard Event Enable PM100D_REG_OPER_COND (4): Operation Condition Register PM100D_REG_OPER_EVENT (5): Operation Event Register PM100D_REG_OPER_ENAB (6): Operation Event Enable Register PM100D_REG_OPER_PTR (7): Operation Positive Transition PM100D_REG_OPER_NTR (8): Operation Negative Transition PM100D_REG_QUES_COND (9): Questionable Condition Register PM100D_REG_QUES_EVENT (10): Questionable Event Register PM100D_REG_QUES_ENAB (11): Questionable Event Enable Reg. PM100D_REG_QUES_PTR (12): Questionable Positive Transition PM100D_REG_QUES_NTR (13): Questionable Negative Transition PM100D_REG_MEAS_COND (14): Measurement Condition Register PM100D_REG_MEAS_EVENT (15): Measurement Event Register PM100D_REG_MEAS_ENAB (16): Measurement Event Enable Register PM100D_REG_MEAS_PTR (17): Measurement Positive Transition PM100D_REG_MEAS_NTR (18): Measurement Negative Transition PM100D_REG_AUX_COND (19): Auxiliary Condition Register PM100D_REG_AUX_EVENT (20): Auxiliary Event Register PM100D_REG_AUX_ENAB (21): Auxiliary Event Enable Register PM100D_REG_AUX_PTR (22): Auxiliary Positive Transition PM100D_REG_AUX_NTR (23): Auxiliary Negative Transition
This parameter returns the register value.
member.returns: This is the error code returned by the function call. For error codes and descriptions see <Error Message>.

member.name: M:Thorlabs.PM100D.PM100D.setAvgCnt(System.Int16)
member.summary: This function sets the average count for measurement value generation.
member.param:
This parameter specifies the average count. The default value is 1.
Remark: Internal there are taken 3000 measurements per second. And so the Average Time = Average Count / 3000 [s]. To get an measurement value from the device the timeout in your application has to be longer than the calculated average time.
member.returns: This is the error code returned by the function call. For error codes and descriptions see <Error Message>.

member.name: M:Thorlabs.PM100D.PM100D.getAvgCnt(System.Int16@)
member.summary: This function returns the average count for measurement value generation.
member.param:
This parameter returns the actual Average Count.
Remark: Internal there are taken 3000 measurements per second. And so the Average Time = Average Count / 3000 [s]. To get an measurement value from the device the timeout in your application has to be longer than the calculated average time.
member.returns: This is the error code returned by the function call. For error codes and descriptions see <Error Message>.

member.summary: This function sets the input attenuation.
member.param: This parameter specifies the input attenuation in dezibel [dB].
member.returns: This is the error code returned by the function call. For error codes and descriptions see <Error Message>.

member.name: M:Thorlabs.PM100D.PM100D.getAttenuation(System.Int16,System.Double@)
member.summary: This function returns the input attenuation.
member.param:
This parameter specifies the value to be queried.
Acceptable values: PM100D_ATTR_SET_VAL (0): Set value PM100D_ATTR_MIN_VAL (1): Minimum value PM100D_ATTR_MAX_VAL (2): Maximum value PM100D_ATTR_DFLT_VAL (3): Default value
This parameter returns the specified input attenuation in dezibel [dB].
member.returns: This is the error code returned by the function call. For error codes and descriptions see <Error Message>.

member.name: M:Thorlabs.PM100D.PM100D.startDarkAdjust
member.summary:
This function starts the dark current/zero offset adjustment procedure.
Remark: (1) You have to darken the input before starting dark/zero adjustment. (2) You can get the state of dark/zero adjustment with <Get Dark Adjustment State> (3) You can stop dark/zero adjustment with <Cancel Dark Adjustment> (4) You get the dark/zero value with <Get Dark Offset> (5) Energy sensors do not support this function
member.returns: This is the error code returned by the function call. For error codes and descriptions see <Error Message>.

member.name: M:Thorlabs.PM100D.PM100D.cancelDarkAdjust
member.summary: This function cancels a running dark current/zero offset adjustment procedure.
member.returns: This is the error code returned by the function call. For error codes and descriptions see <Error Message>.

member.name: M:Thorlabs.PM100D.PM100D.getDarkAdjustState(System.Int16@)
member.summary: This function returns the state of a currently running dark current/zero offset adjustment procedure.
member.param:
This parameter returns the dark adjustment state.
Possible return values are: PM100D_STAT_DARK_ADJUST_FINISHED (0) : no dark adjustment running PM100D_STAT_DARK_ADJUST_RUNNING (1) : dark adjustment is running
member.returns: This is the error code returned by the function call. For error codes and descriptions see <Error Message>.

member.name: M:Thorlabs.PM100D.PM100D.getDarkOffset(System.Double@)
member.summary:
This function returns the dark/zero offset.
The function is not supported with energy sensors.
member.param:
This parameter returns the dark/zero offset.
The unit of the returned offset value depends on the sensor type. Photodiodes return the dark offset in ampere [A]. Thermal sensors return the dark offset in volt [V].
member.returns: This is the error code returned by the function call. For error codes and descriptions see <Error Message>.

member.name: M:Thorlabs.PM100D.PM100D.getFreqRange(System.Double@,System.Double@)
member.summary:
This function returns the instruments frequency range.
Remark: The frequency of the input signal is calculated over at least 0.3s. So it takes at least 0.3s to get a new frequency value from the instrument.
member.param: This parameter returns the lower instruments frequency.
This parameter returns the upper instruments frequency.
member.returns: This is the error code returned by the function call. For error codes and descriptions see <Error Message>.

member.returns: This is the error code returned by the function call. For error codes and descriptions see <Error Message>.

member.name: M:Thorlabs.PM100D.PM100D.setAccelMode(System.Boolean)
member.summary:
This function sets the thermopile acceleration auto mode.
While thermopile acceleration improves displaying changing measurement values it unfortunately adds extra noise which can become noticeable on constant values measurements. With acceleration mode set to AUTO the instrument enables the acceleration circuitry after big measurement values for five times of "Tau". See also functions "Set Thermopile Accelerator Tau" and "Set Thermopile Accelerator State".
With calling "Set Thermopile Accelerator State" the accelerator mode will always be reset to MANUAL.
member.param:
This parameter specifies the thermopile acceleration mode.
Acceptable values: PM100D_ACCELERATION_MANUAL (0): auto acceleration off PM100D_ACCELERATION_AUTO (1): auto acceleration on
member.returns:
This value shows the status code returned by the function call.
For Status Codes see function <Error Message>.

member.name: M:Thorlabs.PM100D.PM100D.getAccelMode(System.Boolean@)
member.summary: This function returns the thermopile acceleration mode.
member.param:
This parameter returns the thermopile acceleration mode.
Return values: PM100D_ACCELERATION_MANUAL (0): auto acceleration off PM100D_ACCELERATION_AUTO (1): auto acceleration on
member.returns: This is the error code returned by the function call. For error codes and descriptions see <Error Message>.

member.name: M:Thorlabs.PM100D.PM100D.setAccelTau(System.Double)
member.summary: This function sets the thermopile acceleration time constant in seconds [s].
member.param: This parameter specifies the thermopile acceleration time constant in seconds [s].
member.returns: This is the error code returned by the function call. For error codes and descriptions see <Error Message>.

member.name: M:Thorlabs.PM100D.PM100D.getAccelTau(System.Int16,System.Double@)
member.summary: This function returns the thermopile acceleration time constant in seconds [s].
member.param:
This parameter specifies the value to be queried.
Acceptable values: PM100D_ATTR_SET_VAL (0): Set value PM100D_ATTR_MIN_VAL (1): Minimum value PM100D_ATTR_MAX_VAL (2): Maximum value PM100D_ATTR_DFLT_VAL (3): Default value
This parameter returns the thermopile acceleration time constant in seconds [s].
member.returns: This is the error code returned by the function call. For error codes and descriptions see <Error Message>.

member.name: M:Thorlabs.PM100D.PM100D.setInputAdapterType(System.Int16)
member.summary: This function sets the sensor type to assume for custom sensors without calibration data memory connected to the instrument.
member.param:
This parameter specifies the custom sensor type.
Acceptable values: SENSOR_TYPE_PD_SINGLE 0x01 // Photodiode sensor SENSOR_TYPE_THERMO 0x02 // Thermopile sensor SENSOR_TYPE_PYRO 0x03 // Pyroelectric sensor
Value SENSOR_TYPE_PYRO is only available for energy meter instruments.
member.returns:
This value shows the status code returned by the function call.
For Status Codes see function <Error Message>.

member.name: M:Thorlabs.PM100D.PM100D.getInputAdapterType(System.Int16@)
member.summary: This function returns the assumed sensor type for custom sensors without calibration data memory connected to the instrument.
member.param:
This parameter returns the custom sensor type.
Remark: The meanings of the obtained sensor type are:
Sensor Types: SENSOR_TYPE_PD_SINGLE 0x01 // Photodiode sensor SENSOR_TYPE_THERMO 0x02 // Thermopile sensor SENSOR_TYPE_PYRO 0x03 // Pyroelectric sensor
member.returns: This is the error code returned by the function call. For error codes and descriptions see <Error Message>.

member.name: M:Thorlabs.PM100D.PM100D.measCurrent(System.Double@)
member.summary:
This function is used to obtain current readings from the instrument.
Remark: This function starts a new measurement cycle and after finishing measurement the result is received. Subject to the actual Average Count this may take up to seconds. Refer to <Set/Get Average Count>.
member.param:
This parameter returns the current in amperes [A].
Remark: This function starts a new measurement cycle and after finishing measurement the result is received. Subject to the actual Average Count this may take up to seconds. Refer to <Set/Get Average Count>.
member.returns: This is the error code returned by the function call. For error codes and descriptions see <Error Message>.

This parameter returns the power in the selected unit.

member.summary: This function returns the device identification information.
member.param:
This parameter returns the manufacturer name.
Notes: (1) The array must contain at least 256 elements ViChar[256]. (2) You may pass VI_NULL if you do not need this value.

This parameter returns the device name.
Notes: (1) The array must contain at least 256 elements ViChar[256]. (2) You may pass VI_NULL if you do not need this value.

This parameter returns the device serial number.
Notes: (1) The array must contain at least 256 elements ViChar[256]. (2) You may pass VI_NULL if you do not need this value.

This parameter returns the device firmware revision.
Notes: (1) The array must contain at least 256 elements ViChar[256]. (2) You may pass VI_NULL if you do not need this value.

member.name: M:Thorlabs.PM100D.PM100D.reset
member.summary: This function resets the device.

member.name: M:Thorlabs.PM100D.PM100D.selfTest(System.Int16@,System.Text.StringBuilder)
member.summary: This function runs the device self test routine and returns the test result.
member.param: This parameter contains the value returned from the device self test routine. A retured zero value indicates a successful run, a value other than zero indicates failure.

This parameter returns the interpreted code as an user readable message string.
Notes: (1) The array must contain at least 256 elements ViChar[256].
member.returns: This is the error code returned by the function call. For error codes and descriptions see <Error Message>.

member.name: M:Thorlabs.PM100D.PM100D.errorQueryMode(System.Boolean)
member.summary: This function selects the driver's error query mode.
member.param:
This parameter specifies the driver's error query mode.
If set to Automatic each driver function queries the instrument's error queue and in case an error occured returns the error number.
If set to Manual the driver does not query the instrument for errors and therefore a driver function does not return instrument errors. You should use <Error Query> to manually query the instrument's error queue.
VI_OFF (0): Manual error query. VI_ON (1): Automatic error query (default).
member.returns: This is the error code returned by the function call. For error codes and descriptions see <Error Message>.

member.name: M:Thorlabs.PM100D.PM100D.errorQuery(System.Int32@,System.Text.StringBuilder)
member.summary:
This function queries the instrument's error queue manually. Use this function to query the instrument's error queue if the driver's error query mode is set to manual query.
Notes: (1) The returned values are stored in the drivers error store. You may use <Error Message> to get a descriptive text at a later point of time.
member.param:
This parameter returns the instrument error number.
Notes: (1) You may pass VI_NULL if you don't need this value.

This parameter returns the instrument error message.
Notes: (1) The array must contain at least 256 elements ViChar[256]. (2) You may pass VI_NULL if you do not need this value.
member.returns: This is the error code returned by the function call. For error codes and descriptions see <Error Message>.

member.name: M:Thorlabs.PM100D.PM100D.revisionQuery(System.Text.StringBuilder,System.Text.StringBuilder)
member.summary: This function returns the revision numbers of the instrument driver and the device firmware.
member.param:
This parameter returns the Instrument Driver revision.
Notes: (1) The array must contain at least 256 elements ViChar[256]. (2) You may pass VI_NULL if you do not need this value.

This parameter returns the device firmware revision.
Notes: (1) The array must contain at least 256 elements ViChar[256]. (2) You may pass VI_NULL if you do not need this value.
member.returns: This is the error code returned by the function call. For error codes and descriptions see <Error Message>.

Low level: VI_OFF (0) High level: VI_ON (1)

This parameter returns the I/O port #0 level where VI_OFF (0) indicates low level and VI_ON (1) indicates high level.
Note: You may pass VI_NULL if you don't need this value.

This parameter returns the I/O port #1 level where VI_OFF (0) indicates low level and VI_ON (1) indicates high level.
Note: You may pass VI_NULL if you don't need this value.

This parameter returns the I/O port #2 level where VI_OFF (0) indicates low level and VI_ON (1) indicates high level.
Note: You may pass VI_NULL if you don't need this value.

This parameter returns the I/O port #3 level where VI_OFF (0) indicates low level and VI_ON (1) indicates high level.
Note: You may pass VI_NULL if you don't need this value.
member.returns: This is the error code returned by the function call. For error codes and descriptions see <Error Message>.

member.summary: This function writes directly to the instrument.
member.param: Data to send to the instrument.
member.returns: This is the error code returned by the function call. For error codes and descriptions see <Error Message>.

member.name: M:Thorlabs.PM100D.PM100D.readRaw(System.Text.StringBuilder,System.UInt32,System.UInt32@)
member.summary: This function reads directly from the instrument.
member.param: Data read from the instrument.
This parameter specifies the buffer size.

Number of bytes actually transferred.
Notes: (1) You may pass VI_NULL if you don't need this value.

member.name: M:Thorlabs.PM100D.PM100D.getSensorInfo(System.Text.StringBuilder,System.Text.StringBuilder,System.Text.StringBuilder,System.Int16@,System.Int16@,System.Int16@)
member.summary:
This function is used to obtain informations from the connected sensor like sensor name, serial number, calibration message, sensor type, sensor subtype and sensor flags.
Remark: The meanings of the obtained sensor type, subtype and flags are:
Sensor Types: SENSOR_TYPE_NONE 0x00 // No sensor SENSOR_TYPE_PD_SINGLE 0x01 // Photodiode sensor SENSOR_TYPE_THERMO 0x02 // Thermopile sensor SENSOR_TYPE_PYRO 0x03 // Pyroelectric sensor
Sensor Subtypes: SENSOR_SUBTYPE_NONE 0x00 // No sensor
Sensor Subtypes Photodiode: SENSOR_SUBTYPE_PD_ADAPTER 0x01 // Photodiode adapter SENSOR_SUBTYPE_PD_SINGLE_STD 0x02 // Photodiode sensor SENSOR_SUBTYPE_PD_SINGLE_FSR 0x03 // Photodiode sensor with integrated filter identified by position SENSOR_SUBTYPE_PD_SINGLE_STD_T 0x12 // Photodiode sensor with temperature sensor Sensor Subtypes Thermopile: SENSOR_SUBTYPE_THERMO_ADAPTER 0x01 // Thermopile adapter SENSOR_SUBTYPE_THERMO_STD 0x02 // Thermopile sensor SENSOR_SUBTYPE_THERMO_STD_T 0x12 // Thermopile sensor with temperature sensor Sensor Subtypes Pyroelectric Sensor: SENSOR_SUBTYPE_PYRO_ADAPTER 0x01 // Pyroelectric adapter SENSOR_SUBTYPE_PYRO_STD 0x02 // Pyroelectric sensor SENSOR_SUBTYPE_PYRO_STD_T 0x12 // Pyroelectric sensor with temperature sensor Sensor Flags: PM100D_SENS_FLAG_IS_POWER 0x0001 // Power sensor PM100D_SENS_FLAG_IS_ENERGY 0x0002 // Energy sensor PM100D_SENS_FLAG_IS_RESP_SET 0x0010 // Responsivity settable PM100D_SENS_FLAG_IS_WAVEL_SET 0x0020 // Wavelength settable PM100D_SENS_FLAG_IS_TAU_SET 0x0040 // Time constant settable PM100D_SENS_FLAG_HAS_TEMP 0x0100 // With Temperature sensor
member.param: This parameter returns the name of the connected sensor.
This parameter returns the serial number of the connected sensor.
This parameter returns the calibration message of the connected sensor.

This parameter returns the sensor type of the connected sensor.
Remark: The meanings of the obtained sensor type are:
Sensor Types: SENSOR_TYPE_NONE 0x00 // No sensor SENSOR_TYPE_PD_SINGLE 0x01 // Photodiode sensor SENSOR_TYPE_THERMO 0x02 // Thermopile sensor SENSOR_TYPE_PYRO 0x03 // Pyroelectric sensor

This parameter returns the subtype of the connected sensor.
Remark: The meanings of the obtained sensor subtype are:
Sensor Subtypes: SENSOR_SUBTYPE_NONE 0x00 // No sensor
Sensor Subtypes Photodiode: SENSOR_SUBTYPE_PD_ADAPTER 0x01 // Photodiode adapter SENSOR_SUBTYPE_PD_SINGLE_STD 0x02 // Photodiode sensor SENSOR_SUBTYPE_PD_SINGLE_FSR 0x03 // Photodiode sensor with integrated filter identified by position SENSOR_SUBTYPE_PD_SINGLE_STD_T 0x12 // Photodiode sensor with temperature sensor Sensor Subtypes Thermopile: SENSOR_SUBTYPE_THERMO_ADAPTER 0x01 // Thermopile adapter SENSOR_SUBTYPE_THERMO_STD 0x02 // Thermopile sensor SENSOR_SUBTYPE_THERMO_STD_T 0x12 // Thermopile sensor with temperature sensor Sensor Subtypes Pyroelectric Sensor: SENSOR_SUBTYPE_PYRO_ADAPTER 0x01 // Pyroelectric adapter SENSOR_SUBTYPE_PYRO_STD 0x02 // Pyroelectric sensor SENSOR_SUBTYPE_PYRO_STD_T 0x12 // Pyroelectric sensor with temperature sensor

This parameter returns the flags of the connected sensor.
Remark: The meanings of the obtained sensor flags are:
Sensor Flags: PM100D_SENS_FLAG_IS_POWER 0x0001 // Power sensor PM100D_SENS_FLAG_IS_ENERGY 0x0002 // Energy sensor PM100D_SENS_FLAG_IS_RESP_SET 0x0010 // Responsivity settable PM100D_SENS_FLAG_IS_WAVEL_SET 0x0020 // Wavelength settable PM100D_SENS_FLAG_IS_TAU_SET 0x0040 // Time constant settable PM100D_SENS_FLAG_HAS_TEMP 0x0100 // With Temperature sensor
member.returns: This is the error code returned by the function call. For error codes and descriptions see <Error Message>.

member.name: P:Thorlabs.PM100D.PM100D.Handle
member.summary: Gets the instrument handle.
member.value: The value is the IntPtr that represents the handle to the instrument.
